abstract: Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of New York helps Susan Bentley of Manhattan, ironworker whose expertise put her on front lines at World Trade Center recovery, eventually leading to serious illness, pay her rent.
lead_paragraph: As an ironworker in New York City, Susan Bentley’s expertise placed her on the front lines with rescue workers after the Sept. 11 terrorist attack. But she suffered debilitating illnesses from working at ground zero.

headline.main: Sickened in Rubble After 9/11, a ‘Lost Soul’ Longs for Her Old Life
headline.print_headline: Sickened in Rubble After 9/11, a ‘Lost Soul’ Longs for Her Old Life

snippet: As an ironworker in New York City, Susan Bentley’s expertise placed her on the front lines with rescue workers after the Sept. 11 terrorist attack. But she suffered debilitating illnesses from working at ground zero.
